'''Dima Khatib''' (born 1971)<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.nytimes.com/1999/07/04/world/arab-tv-gets-a-new-slant-newscasts-without-censorship.html?pagewanted=4 | work=The New York Times | title=Arab TV Gets a New Slant: Newscasts Without Censorship | date=1999-07-04}}</ref> is a Syrian-born Palestinian <ref>http://www.dimakhatib.com/</ref> journalist. Since 1997, she has worked as a correspondent, producer, and Latin America Bureau Chief for the [[Al Jazeera]] network.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sandraoffthestrip.com/tag/dima-khatib/ |title=Dima Khatib | Off the Strip for free thinkers and adventurers |publisher=Sandraoffthestrip.com |date=2011-02-18 |accessdate=2011-04-12}}</ref><ref>{{cite book |title= Global Media Go to War: Role of News and Entertainment Media During the 2003 Iraq War|editor=Ralph D. Berenger |year=2004 |publisher=Marquette Books |location= |isbn=9780922993109 |page=66 |pages= |url=http://books.google.com.tr/books?id=d6LtAAAAMAAJ&q=%22dima+khatib%22&dq=%22dima+khatib%22&hl=tr&ei=s_SITczrOsXOswbl0bi-DA&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=1&ved=0CC0Q6AEwAA}}</ref>

'''Ø¯ÙÙØ© Ø®Ø·ÙØ¨''' {{lang-ar|Ø­Ø³Ø§Ù Ø§ÙØ­ÙÙØ§ÙÙ}} is a [[Syria]]n-born [[Palestine|Palestinian]] <ref>http://www.dimakhatib.com/</ref> journalist. Since 1997, she has worked as a correspondent, producer, and Latin America Bureau Chief for the [[Al Jazeera]] network.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sandraoffthestrip.com/tag/dima-khatib/ |title=Dima Khatib | Off the Strip for free thinkers and adventurers |publisher=Sandraoffthestrip.com |date=2011-02-18 |accessdate=2011-04-12}}</ref><ref>{{cite book |title= Global Media Go to War: Role of News and Entertainment Media During the 2003 Iraq War|editor=Ralph D. Berenger |year=2004 |publisher=Marquette Books |location= |isbn=9780922993109 |page=66 |pages= |url=http://books.google.com.tr/books?id=d6LtAAAAMAAJ&q=%22dima+khatib%22&dq=%22dima+khatib%22&hl=tr&ei=s_SITczrOsXOswbl0bi-DA&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=1&ved=0CC0Q6AEwAA}}</ref>
Prior to her work with Al Jazeera, Khatib has worked for Swiss Radio International in [[Bern]]. During the [[Iraq War]], she worked as a live news producer in [[Doha]]. She gave an interview to CNN's [[Larry King]] and [[Wolf Blitzer]],<ref>{{cite news| url=http://transcripts.cnn.com/TRANSCRIPTS/0304/09/lkl.00.html | work=CNN | title=CNN.com}}</ref> and was featured in ''[[Control Room (film)|Control Room]]'', a 2004 documentary film about Al Jazeera and its coverage of the 2003 invasion of Iraq.<ref>{{cite news| url = http://news.independent.co.uk/media/story.jsp?story=603895
Prior to her work with Al Jazeera, Khatib has worked for Swiss Radio International in [[Bern]]. During the [[Iraq War]], she worked as a live news producer in [[Doha]]. She gave an interview to CNN's [[Larry King]] and [[Wolf Blitzer]],<ref>{{cite news| url=http://transcripts.cnn.com/TRANSCRIPTS/0304/09/lkl.00.html | work=CNN | title=CNN.com}}</ref> and was featured in ''[[Control Room (film)|Control Room]]'', a 2004 documentary film about Al Jazeera and its coverage of the 2003 invasion of Iraq.<ref>{{cite news| url = http://news.independent.co.uk/media/story.jsp?story=603895
